title: Why restoring Stormont could become Boris Johnson's biggest Brexit headache
text:
Boris Johnson’s new Brexit proposals have received a predictable drubbing from the European Union, which still suspects he is not truly committed to avoiding tension on the Irish border.

But there is another component to Mr Johnson’s deal that presents him with a potentially greater challenge to getting a deal across the line - and it sits much closer to home.

For Mr Johnson’s plan to work, a powerful role would be granted to Stormont, the devolved Northern Ireland Assembly that shares power between its unionist and nationalist communities.
